trans-unit.source: View stored procedures, triggers, and user-defined functions using the DocumentDB Script Explorer | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: View stored procedures, triggers, and user-defined functions using the DocumentDB Script Explorer | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn about the DocumentDB Script Explorer, an Azure Preview portal tool to view DocumentDB server-side programming artifacts including stored procedures, triggers, and user-defined functions.
trans-unit.target: Learn about the DocumentDB Script Explorer, an Azure Preview portal tool to view DocumentDB server-side programming artifacts including stored procedures, triggers, and user-defined functions.

trans-unit.source: View, edit, and create stored procedures, triggers, and user-defined functions using the DocumentDB Script Explorer
trans-unit.target: View, edit, and create stored procedures, triggers, and user-defined functions using the DocumentDB Script Explorer

trans-unit.source: This article provides an overview of the [Microsoft Azure DocumentDB](http://azure.microsoft.com/services/documentdb/) Script Explorer, an Azure Preview portal tool that enables you to view DocumentDB server-side programming artifacts including stored procedures, triggers, and user-defined functions.
trans-unit.target: This article provides an overview of the [Microsoft Azure DocumentDB](http://azure.microsoft.com/services/documentdb/) Script Explorer, an Azure Preview portal tool that enables you to view DocumentDB server-side programming artifacts including stored procedures, triggers, and user-defined functions.

trans-unit.source: Read more about DocumentDB server-side programming [here](documentdb-programming.md).
trans-unit.target: Read more about DocumentDB server-side programming [here](documentdb-programming.md).

trans-unit.source: By completing this tutorial, you'll be able to answer the following questions:
trans-unit.target: By completing this tutorial, you'll be able to answer the following questions:

trans-unit.source: How can I easily view DocumentDB stored procedures via a web browser?
trans-unit.target: How can I easily view DocumentDB stored procedures via a web browser?

trans-unit.source: How can I easily view DocumentDB triggers via a web browser?
trans-unit.target: How can I easily view DocumentDB triggers via a web browser?

trans-unit.source: How can I easily view DocumentDB user-defined functions via a web browser?
trans-unit.target: How can I easily view DocumentDB user-defined functions via a web browser?

trans-unit.source: Launch and navigate Script Explorer
trans-unit.target: Launch and navigate Script Explorer

trans-unit.source: Script Explorer can be launched from any of the DocumentDB account, database, and collection blades.
trans-unit.target: Script Explorer can be launched from any of the DocumentDB account, database, and collection blades.

trans-unit.source: At the top of the DocumentDB account or database blade, simply click the **Script Explorer** command.
trans-unit.target: At the top of the DocumentDB account or database blade, simply click the **Script Explorer** command.

trans-unit.source: Screenshot of the Script Explorer command
trans-unit.target: Screenshot of the Script Explorer command

trans-unit.source: Alternatively, near the bottom of each blade is a **Developer Tools** lens that contains the **Script Explorer** part.
trans-unit.target: Alternatively, near the bottom of each blade is a **Developer Tools** lens that contains the **Script Explorer** part.

trans-unit.source: Screenshot of the Script Explorer part
trans-unit.target: Screenshot of the Script Explorer part

trans-unit.source: Simply click the command or the part to launch Script Explorer.
trans-unit.target: Simply click the command or the part to launch Script Explorer.

trans-unit.source: The **Database** and **Collection** drop-down list boxes are pre-populated depending on the context in which you launch Script Explorer.
trans-unit.target: The **Database** and **Collection** drop-down list boxes are pre-populated depending on the context in which you launch Script Explorer.

trans-unit.source: For example, if you launch from a database blade, then the current database is pre-populated.
trans-unit.target: For example, if you launch from a database blade, then the current database is pre-populated.

trans-unit.source: If you launch from a collection blade, then the current collection is pre-populated.
trans-unit.target: If you launch from a collection blade, then the current collection is pre-populated.

trans-unit.source: Screenshot of Script Explorer
trans-unit.target: Screenshot of Script Explorer

trans-unit.source: The **Database** and **Collection** drop-down list boxes can be used to easily change the collection from which scripts are currently being viewed without having to close and re-launch Script Explorer.
trans-unit.target: The **Database** and **Collection** drop-down list boxes can be used to easily change the collection from which scripts are currently being viewed without having to close and re-launch Script Explorer.

trans-unit.source: Script Explorer also supports filtering the currently loaded set of scripts by their id property.
trans-unit.target: Script Explorer also supports filtering the currently loaded set of scripts by their id property.

trans-unit.source: Simply type in the filter box.
trans-unit.target: Simply type in the filter box.

trans-unit.source: Screenshot of Script Explorer with filter highlighted
trans-unit.target: Screenshot of Script Explorer with filter highlighted

trans-unit.source: And the results in the Script Explorer list are filtered based on your supplied criteria.
trans-unit.target: And the results in the Script Explorer list are filtered based on your supplied criteria.

trans-unit.source: Screenshot of Script Explorer with filtered results
trans-unit.target: Screenshot of Script Explorer with filtered results

trans-unit.source: To refresh the list of scripts loaded by Script Explorer, simply click the **Refresh** command at the top of the blade.
trans-unit.target: To refresh the list of scripts loaded by Script Explorer, simply click the **Refresh** command at the top of the blade.

trans-unit.source: Screenshot of Script Explorer refresh command
trans-unit.target: Screenshot of Script Explorer refresh command

trans-unit.source: View, edit, create, and delete stored procedures, triggers, and user-defined functions with Script Explorer
trans-unit.target: View, edit, create, and delete stored procedures, triggers, and user-defined functions with Script Explorer

trans-unit.source: Script Explorer allows you to easily perform CRUD operations on DocumentDB server-side programming artifacts.
trans-unit.target: Script Explorer allows you to easily perform CRUD operations on DocumentDB server-side programming artifacts.

trans-unit.source: To create a script, simply click on the applicable create command within script explorer, provide an id, enter the contents of the script, and click the **Save** command.
trans-unit.target: To create a script, simply click on the applicable create command within script explorer, provide an id, enter the contents of the script, and click the **Save** command.

trans-unit.source: Screenshot of Script Explorer create option
trans-unit.target: Screenshot of Script Explorer create option

trans-unit.source: When creating a trigger, you must also specify the trigger type and trigger operation
trans-unit.target: When creating a trigger, you must also specify the trigger type and trigger operation

trans-unit.source: Screenshot of Script Explorer create trigger option
trans-unit.target: Screenshot of Script Explorer create trigger option

trans-unit.source: To view a script, simply click the script in which you're interested.
trans-unit.target: To view a script, simply click the script in which you're interested.

trans-unit.source: Screenshot of Script Explorer view script experience
trans-unit.target: Screenshot of Script Explorer view script experience

trans-unit.source: To edit a script, simply make the desired changes and click the **Save** command.
trans-unit.target: To edit a script, simply make the desired changes and click the **Save** command.

trans-unit.source: Screenshot of Script Explorer view script experience
trans-unit.target: Screenshot of Script Explorer view script experience

trans-unit.source: To discard any pending changes to a script, simply click the **Discard** command.
trans-unit.target: To discard any pending changes to a script, simply click the **Discard** command.

trans-unit.source: Screenshot of Script Explorer discard changes experience
trans-unit.target: Screenshot of Script Explorer discard changes experience

trans-unit.source: Script Explorer also allows you to easily view the system properties of the currently loaded script by clicking the **Properties** command.
trans-unit.target: Script Explorer also allows you to easily view the system properties of the currently loaded script by clicking the **Properties** command.

trans-unit.source: Screenshot of Script Explorer script properties view
trans-unit.target: Screenshot of Script Explorer script properties view

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] The timestamp (_ts) property is internally represented as epoch time, but Script Explorer displays the value in a human readable GMT format.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] The timestamp (_ts) property is internally represented as epoch time, but Script Explorer displays the value in a human readable GMT format.

trans-unit.source: To delete a script, select it in Script Explorer and click the **Delete** command.
trans-unit.target: To delete a script, select it in Script Explorer and click the **Delete** command.

trans-unit.source: Screenshot of Script Explorer delete command
trans-unit.target: Screenshot of Script Explorer delete command

trans-unit.source: Confirm the delete action by clicking **Yes** or cancel the delete action by clicking **No**.
trans-unit.target: Confirm the delete action by clicking **Yes** or cancel the delete action by clicking **No**.

trans-unit.source: Screenshot of Script Explorer delete command
trans-unit.target: Screenshot of Script Explorer delete command

trans-unit.source: Next steps
trans-unit.target: Next steps

trans-unit.source: To learn more about DocumentDB, click [here](http://azure.com/docdb).
trans-unit.target: To learn more about DocumentDB, click [here](http://azure.com/docdb).

trans-unit.source: test
trans-unit.target: test
